entry.title: Strobilanthes tonkinensis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the dried leaves of Strobilanthes tonkinensis (examples pictured) give black tea a sticky rice flavor?

entry.title: Emily Ausmus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at age 12, Emily Ausmus participated in an international water polo tournament against players as old as 19?

entry.title: a crab species (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a crab species was named after both an ancient board game and a League of Legends character?

entry.title: Cho Myung-chul (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cho Myung-chul was the first North Korean defector to be elected to the South Korean National Assembly?

entry.title: Philippines at the 1924 Summer Olympics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the flagbearer for the Philippines at the 1924 Summer Olympics also carried a flag of the United States?

entry.title: Carl Friedrich Gauss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a geographer determined the surface area of Carl Friedrich Gauss's brain?

entry.title: a Kentucky TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Kentucky TV station gained industry attention after it criticized the overuse of the term "breaking news"?

entry.title: George Hunter Cary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that citizens of New Westminster burnt effigies of Attorney General George Hunter Cary and drowned the ashes?

entry.title: tomato sandwich (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that many enthusiasts say that a good tomato sandwich is so messy, it should be eaten over the kitchen sink?
